author: guidovbrakel
body:
PS C:\Users\hostadmin\Desktop> `New-VM -Name WinAutoPilot02 -Generation 2 -NewVHDPath F:\VMs\boot2.vhdx -SwitchName NestedSwitch -MemoryStartupBytes 1GB -NewVHDSizeBytes 25639780352`
New-VM : Sequence contains more than one element
At line:1 char:1
+ New-VM -Name WinAutoPilot02 -Generation 2 -NewVHDPath F:\VMs\boot2.vh ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [New-VM], VirtualizationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvalidOperation,Microsoft.HyperV.PowerShell.Commands.NewVM

What's is this of an error?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@guidovbrakel The `Hyper-V` module is not owned by this repository. It may be more helpful to search the error message or ask on stack overflow for your questions. A quick search found this thread: https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/679072da-4b5c-444e-802e-182e2e2c8d63/hyperv-quick-create-gives-error-quotsequence-contains-no-matching-elementsquot?forum=win10itprovirt. Hope you can find some useful information there.
Hyper-V quick create gives error "Sequence contains no matching elements"

title: Hyper-V Powershell : Sequence contains more than one element
